title: [700. Search in a Binary Search Tree](https://leetcode.cn/problems/search-in-a-binary-search-tree/)
content:
| English | 简体中文 |
700. Search in a Binary Search Tree Description You are given the root of a binary search tree (BST) and an integer val.
Find the node in the BST that the node's value equals val and return the subtree rooted with that node. If such a node does not exist, return null.
 
Example 1:
Input: root = [4,2,7,1,3], val = 2 Output: [2,1,3] Example 2:
Input: root = [4,2,7,1,3], val = 5 Output: []  
Constraints:
The number of nodes in the tree is in the range [1, 5000]. 1 <= Node.val <= 107 root is a binary search tree. 1 <= val <= 107 Related Topics Tree Binary Search Tree Binary Tree Similar Questions Closest Binary Search Tree Value Insert into a Binary Search Tree Closest Nodes Queries in a Binary Search Tree
